aima.core.environment.vacuum

Class VacuumEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • aima.core.agent.impl.AbstractEnvironment
      • aima.core.environment.vacuum.VacuumEnvironment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Environment, EnvironmentViewNotifier
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NondeterministicVacuumEnvironment

    public class VacuumEnvironment
extends AbstractEnvironment
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): pg 58.

    Let the world contain just two locations. Each location may or may not contain dirt, and the agent may be in one location or the other. There are 8 possible world states, as shown in Figure 3.2. The agent has three possible actions in this version of the vacuum world: Left, Right, and Suck. Assume for the moment, that sucking is 100% effective. The goal is to clean up all the dirt.
    Author:
    Ravi Mohan, Ciaran O'Reilly, Mike Stampone

                         VacuumEnvironment.LocationState locBState)
        Constructs a vacuum environment with two locations, in which dirt is placed as specified.
        Parameters:
        locAState - the initial state of location A, which is either Clean or Dirty.
        locBState - the initial state of location B, which is either Clean or Dirty.
